It requires 30 Attack and 30 Magic to wield. The mystic smoke staff is an even stronger alternative, providing better melee and magic stat bonuses.

A smoke battlestaff is a smoke elemental staff which provides unlimited amounts of air and fire runes as well as the autocast option when equipped. It requires 30 Attack and 30 Magic to wield. The mystic smoke staff is an even stronger alternative, providing better melee and magic stat bonuses.

This staff provides a 10% increase in accuracy and damage when casting spells from the standard spellbook.

The staff is only obtainable as a potential drop from the Thermonuclear smoke devil.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
22 September 2021
(update)

The Magic Attack and Defence bonuses of battlestaves have been increased from +10 to +12.

8 October 2015
(update)

The smoke battlestaff and mystic smoke staff now provide a 10% increase in accuracy and damage when used to cast spells from the standard spellbook.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Due to the strength of fire spells and the popularity of splashing, the smoke battlestaff became the most expensive battlestaff almost immediately after it was introduced to the game. On 10 September 2015, splashing was nerfed, and the price of the staff plummeted to less than a quarter of its peak. To compensate for this nerf and to make the staff worth using, it was given its 10% bonus to magical accuracy and strength in a buff on 8 October 2015.

[[File:Smoke battlestaff detail animated.gif|left|180px]]
A '''smoke battlestaff''' is a smoke [[Elemental staves|elemental staff]] which provides unlimited amounts of [[Air rune|air]] and [[Fire rune|fire]] runes as well as the [[autocast]] option when equipped. It requires 30 [[Attack]] and 30 [[Magic]] to wield. The [[mystic smoke staff]] is an even stronger alternative, providing better melee and magic stat bonuses.

This staff provides a 10% increase in accuracy and damage when casting spells from the [[standard spellbook]].

The staff is only obtainable as a potential drop from the [[Thermonuclear smoke devil]].

==Trivia==
*Due to the strength of [[fire spells]] and the popularity of [[splashing]], the smoke battlestaff became the most expensive battlestaff almost immediately after it was introduced to the game. On [[10 September]] [[2015]], splashing was nerfed, and the price of the staff plummeted to less than a quarter of its peak. To compensate for this nerf and to make the staff worth using, it was given its 10% bonus to magical accuracy and strength in a buff on [[8 October]] [[2015]].
